##Objective

To create an automated workflow using Make.com that processes meeting confirmations received via email and converts them into Google Calendar events with specific details.

General Task Flow

![C:\Users\Adeen\Downloads\task1 (1).png]
Overview

**Step1:** Making An Account On <https://www.make.com/> using the new email and credentials from above.

**Step2:** Creating A Make Scenario that gets triggered when an email is sent

![](data:im

**Step 3:** Setting Up The Email Module

Move to the scenario tab and select the email module.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

![](data:image/png;base64,i

Next set the information as follows:

![](data:image/png;base64,

To trigger event, the sender of email must be [sttrinityassessment2@gmail.com](mailto:sttrinityassessment2@gmail.com).

Gmail query used: from:sttrinityassessment2@gmail.com "Your appointment has been scheduled" ("Contact Name:" OR "Date and Time:")

The emails will not be received until we create the connection between make and gmail. This is done by using gmail API. To enable the API follow the following steps:

Visit the google cloud console and create a new project

![](data:image/png;base64,)

![](data:image/png;base64,

Once created move to [_APIs & Services_](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis?inv=1&invt=AbmemA&organizationId=0&project=mythical-lyceum-447414-j3) _/_[_API Library_](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/library?inv=1&invt=AbmemA&organizationId=0&project=mythical-lyceum-447414-j3). Search for gmail API and then enable it

![](data:image/png;basAEIAAB5gLIVJiTIiAEIAABCEAAAswEkKkwo0QgCEAAAhCAAASYCyBTYU6KgBCAAAQgAAEIMBNApsKMEoEgAAEIQAACEGAugEyFOSkCQgACEIAABCDATACZCjNKBIIABCAAAQhAgLkAMhXmpAgIAQhAAAIQgAAzAWQqzCgRCAIQgAAEIAAB5gLIVJiTIiAEIAABCEAAAswEkKkwo0QgCEAAAhCAAASYCyBTYU6KgBCAAAQgAAEIMBP4fwKmP9q7A3AaAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

Creating an authorization screen which will let us access gmail/project from make

![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KG10oM
Only allowed users will be able to access the email.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

Since sometimes the previous name of make.com is used so, we will add both domain names

![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0ZDwmQAAmQQFUmQL2syq3LupEACZAACdiKAPXSViSZDwmQAAmQQFUmQL2syq3LupEACZAACdiKAPXSViSZDwmQAAmQQFUmQL2syq3LupEACZAACdiKAPXSViSZDwmQAAmQQFUmQL2syq3LupEACZAACdiKAPXSViSZDwmQAAmQQFUmQL2syq3LupEACZAACdiKwP8DpBIJB9y6C8wAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

The scope will tell what the integration will be allowed to do with the gmail API which is limiting the results to gmail API

![](data:image/png;base64,)

![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KJAAAiEhwBkFeHhCFKAABAAAkAACAAByCogBoAAEAACQAAIAIHwEICsIjwcQQoQAAJAAAgAASDw/wMV0/hwOn1QuwAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

These are some scopes needed for gmail integration with make. Select these and click update

Next is adding the test users. We will use our gmail [_sttrinityassessment2@gmail.com_](mailto:sttrinityassessment2@gmail.com) as test user.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

Next step is to create credentials to restrict unauthorized access.

![](data:image/png;base64,QmCC)

![](data:image/png;base64,)

Click create and it will generate the client ID and client secret. Copy and store them is a safe place.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

Now connection with gmail can be established in make.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

Then click sign in with google and use the same email account used for google cloud console.

**Step 4**: Extracting Information From Email

Create regex using websites <https://regex-generator.olafneumann.org/> and <https://regex101.com/>

The test parser module will be used to parse key:value pairs from the email body.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

Once parsed they will be passed on to an array aggregator which will combine all the output bundles into a single one and therefore can be easily used later.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

**Step 5**: Extracting Links From Email Body

The test parser module will parse the links from the html content

![](data:image/png;base64,)

Once parsed we will again use the aggregator to combine our bundles.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

**Step 6**: Storing All Information Into Variables

We will use the multiple variable tool to store all the extracted data.

![](data:image/png;)

Since date is in string we parse it to convert it to date format that will be further used in sheets and calender.

**Step 7:** Obtaining The Owner ID

We again parse the meeting link to get the owner id. This ID will be used to look up the consultants information from the google sheets.

![](data:)

**Step 8:** Add Extracted Data Into Google Sheets

Since we have already created the following sheet “Assessment” having consultants data, we created a new sheet named as extractedData and here we are going to add extracted values

Sheet 1: consultants

![](data:image/png;base64,)

Sheet 2: extractedData

![](data:image/png;base64,)

First connect the google sheet API with the same process done with gmail integration

![](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KG
The values that need to be added into the sheets are as follows:

![](data:image/png;base64,)

Also add a break to handle any errors that arise due to google sheets.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

**Step 9:** Looking Up Consultant ID

A google sheet search module helps in finding the data in a sheet. The consultant ID is used to get further information about consultant from the available data.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

![](data:image/png;base64,CAHDEZDL5ThAvaCgIDg4WCeCoX3GDAffhBJgtaBE0WsgajEhyiSaECAE1COAxgdNEBoiNEd64ETjLnqA1hFR4BBzd3fviJQoDUKAECAE1COAhgjNkR4IEbvoAVpHRMFYC1ktHQE0pUEIEAIaEUBDpN/QL7EL1SxCgBAgBAgB4yNA7GJ8TEkiIUAIEAKEALEL1QFCgBAgBAgB4yPw/0M5Yll+KamOAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

**Step 10:** Generating Event In The Google Calender

Connect the google calender API with the same process done above for gmail and sheets.

Once linked add the information in the module.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

![](data:image/png;base64,OQcAlldLW8M1/15O+Z79r9JZC9T7xq1fyP0lBuw51w1i8GCgCCQcQSyzZ7BAsl77hmvVxEoCAgCHY1Al2DPji6kyBcEBAFBIOMIZDPumfHCiEBBQBAQBDoNAWHPToNaFAkCgkC3QkDYs1tVpxRGEBAEOg0BYc9Og1oUCQKCQLdCQNizW1WnFEYQEAQ6DQFhz06DWhQJAoJAt0JA2LNbVacURhAQBDoNAWHPToNaFAkCgkC3QuD/A+nX64P98Dr/AAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

![](data:image/png;base64,JgZIYbCTASbSMQELAhmEYqSTR522vHUbIoARUAqAtRdSkWMlqcIUAQcFAGbWBl3UOxpsykCFAG7QoC6S7vqLmosRYAiUHUIUHdZddhTzRQBioBdIUDdpV11FzWWIkARqDoEqLusOuypZooARcCuEKDu0q66ixpLEaAIVB0C1F1WHfZUM0WAImBXCFB3aVfdRY2lCFAEqg4B6i6rDnuqmSJAEbArBKi7tKvuosZSBCgCVYfA/wG5uj8OFoyD/AAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)
